snippet.title: Why should you care about saints?
snippet.description:
* On Sunday, April 27, in Rome, Pope John Paul II and Pope John XXIII will be canonized as saints of the Roman Catholic Church. This event clearly will have intense significance for Catholics, but what about everyone else? Why should non-Catholics even care?
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/opinion/perry-canonization-saints/index.html

snippet.title: Pope Francis washes the feet of disabled people as part of Easter celebrations
snippet.description:
* The washing of feet was a radical act in Jesus' time. It is no less radical in the modern era, with Pope Francis' decision to break with the long-standing papal tradition of washing only priests' feet, to include women and non-Christians in the symbolic ceremony.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/world/europe/pope-francis-washes-feet-of-disabled-people/index.html

snippet.title: Law giving Jerusalem-born U.S. citizens an Israeli birthplace under review
snippet.description:
* The U.S. Supreme Court will take another look at an 11-year-old boy's request to have Israel listed as his place of birth on his U.S. passport.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/21/justice/supreme-court-jerusalem/index.html

snippet.description:

snippet.title: Oceanic salvage manager: How we search for Flight 370
snippet.description:
* The wreckage of Malaysia Flight 370 has yet to be found, and the world has been riveted as search operations attempt to pinpoint the aircraft wreckage on the seafloor and begin to raise it.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/opinion/maclin-flight-370-search/index.html

snippet.title: Heathenism's battle with white supremacists
snippet.description:
* Opinion by Joshua Rood, special to CNN (CNN) – The word “heathen” is a very old one that once meant “heath dweller” or a person who lives out in the wild. Eventually, when Christianity came into Northern Europe, it came to mean “one who still worships...
http://religion.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/16/heathenisms-battle-with-white-supremacists/
